choices.t: to harm or damage further
to restore to normal life through therapy or education
to say something for the first time
to say something again for emphasis or clarity
to hold tightly
to voluntarily give up or surrender something
to make something old or worn-out
to renovate or make something look new again

questions.q: What does 'reconcile' mean in terms of relationships?

choices.t: to argue and increase conflict
to restore friendly relations between parties

questions.q: What does 'reflect' mean in terms of thought?

choices.t: to ignore or dismiss a subject
to think deeply or carefully about something

questions.q: What does 'refrain' mean in terms of behavior?

choices.t: to continue doing something without stopping
to stop oneself from doing something
to wear out or destroy
to grow anew or restore to original condition
to praise or compliment
to express sharp disapproval or criticism
easily broken or damaged
able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
